Thank you for using our app. Kindly note that this application tracks your smoking data based solely on the information provided by you. It employs basic mathematical calculations to determine your smoking status. However, it is important to understand that this app does not possess or claim any medical knowledge or expertise.

For any medical assistance or advice regarding smoking cessation, please consult a qualified medical professional or seek guidance from a healthcare expert. Your health and well-being are of paramount importance.
Wishing you all the best on your journey towards a healthier lifestyle. Stay motivated and prioritize your health.
About Us - Quit Smoking and Breathe Easy Again

Did you know smoking is the leading cause of preventable death globally? Every year, millions of people lose their lives due to smoking-related illnesses. Smoking damages nearly every organ in your body, leading to:
But there\'s hope! Quitting smoking, no matter how long you\'ve been doing it, has immediate and long-term health benefits.
This app is your partner on your journey to a smoke-free life. We provide tools and resources to help you:
• Track your progress: Monitor your cravings, smoke-free days, and money saved.
• Expand your lifeline: See how quitting smoking can add years to your life expectancy.
• Save money: Track the money you\'re saving by not buying cigarettes. You\'d be surprised how quickly it adds up!
The money you save by quitting smoking could be used for:
• A dream vacation
• Upgrading your tech gear
• Contributing to your savings goals
Death is not the only price you pay for smoking. It takes a toll on your finances, your energy levels, and your overall well-being. Quitting is an investment in yourself and your future.
We, the developers, are passionate about helping people quit smoking and live healthier lives. We believe everyone deserves a chance to breathe easy and enjoy a longer, healthier life.
Download the app today and start your journey to a smoke-free future! Share it with your friends and family who might also benefit. Every person who quits makes a difference.
Feeling generous? Consider buying me a coffee to support further development!
buy me a coffee
• Lung cancer: The most common smoking-related cancer, claiming countless lives.
• Heart disease: Smoking clogs arteries and increases the risk of heart attacks and strokes.
• Chronic obstructive pulmonary disease (COPD): This group of lung diseases makes it hard to breathe.
• Cancer of the mouth, throat, esophagus, bladder, and kidney: Smoking increases the risk of these cancers.
